title: WH Smith accelerates US push with £300m deal for Marshall Retail
text:
WH Smith is to buy US company Marshall Retail Group for $400m (£312m) as it pushes ahead with its entry into the American market.

The deal will double the size of the high street stalwart's international business. MRG has 170 stores in North America, 59 of them inside airports, which are being targeted by WH Smith's travel arm for their high footfall and captive audience. The US company also has shops in resorts and tourist sites such as Las Vegas.

WH Smith will pay for the acquisition by raising £155m from shareholders in an underwritten share placing and by taking on more debt.
